What is a limitation of creating currencies from IDs in Verus, and how can I avoid potential problems?

One limitation of creating currencies from IDs in Verus is that you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. This can cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used. To avoid potential problems, it is generally advised not to create IDs with i-addresses as their names.

#### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.### DisclaimerThis is experimental and unfinished software. Use at your own risk! No warranty for any kind of damage!

Is there a limitation on using existing currency names, such as BTC or ETH, as PBaaS chain names in the Verus Desktop GUI?
Yes, in the current Verus Desktop GUI, you cannot use existing currency names, such as BTC or ETH, as PBaaS chain names. This limitation is considered errata and will be addressed in future releases.

#### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. What disclaimer should I be aware of when using Verus software?

Verus software is currently experimental and unfinished. Therefore, it is used at your own risk, and no warranty is provided for any kind of damage. However, the software is open-source, and you are free to use, copy, modify, and distribute it as per the terms of the license agreement.
